messages.message:
Hi team
There is a pymodule cycle detection failure on my backport PR for 24.07: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/15022449068/job/42215965859?pr=70651
So I created another PR hoping to fix it, but it didn't trigger the cycle detection thing: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/70653
I guess since there is no actual code change. How do I test if this fixes the check ?
Since my main PR is a backport, I don't want to include this pymodule change there to keep it clean
@Victor Zeng I saw you did similar change on master for this check, can you help me how to get it corrected?
the first PR 70651 should not have caused the cycle detection check to fail - likely it's failing because of another change that was force merged
from the error it looked like to me that since we use ubuntu latest, python 3.7 may not be supported anymore
okay, that should not be a cause for cycle detection check to fail too
the action is failing on running itself. It didn't find any issue in the PR. :thinking_face:
Easiest way to test is to stack a PR that introduces a cycle.

ah great!,
I did you see your "files changed" but didn't notice the test commits in the PR itself,
will test with this change, :ty:
@Victor Zeng would you please review this short one?
Done. I also updated the jira tag for you
